propel.core.security.cryptography.ciphers

Interface ICipher

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCipherEcb, AESCipherEcb, BlowfishCipherEcb, XTEACipherEcb

    public interface ICipher
    The interface that ciphers adhere to

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void decrypt(byte[] dataIn, byte[] dataOut, int offset, int count)
      Decrypts the provided in data from the offset and puts it in the out data array at the offset.
      void encrypt(byte[] dataIn, byte[] dataOut, int offset, int count)
      Encrypts the provided in data from the offset and puts it in the out data array at the offset.
      int getBlockSize()
      Return the block size of the block cipher
      int[] getKeySizes()
      Returns the supported key sizes of the cipher
      int getRecommendedKeySize()
      Returns the recommended key size of the cipher

    • Method Detail

      • getBlockSize

        int getBlockSize()
        Return the block size of the block cipher

      • getKeySizes

        int[] getKeySizes()
        Returns the supported key sizes of the cipher

      • getRecommendedKeySize

        int getRecommendedKeySize()
        Returns the recommended key size of the cipher

      • encrypt

        void encrypt(byte[] dataIn,
           byte[] dataOut,
           int offset,
           int count)
        Encrypts the provided in data from the offset and puts it in the out data array at the offset. Does this for a specified byte count, which must be a multiple of the cipher's block size.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - An argument is null
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - An index is out of range
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - An argument is out of range, or the output array is not large enough

      • decrypt

        void decrypt(byte[] dataIn,
           byte[] dataOut,
           int offset,
           int count)
        Decrypts the provided in data from the offset and puts it in the out data array at the offset. Does this for a specified byte count, which must be a multiple of the cipher's block size.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - An argument is null
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - An index is out of range
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - An argument is out of range, or the output array is not large enough
